Notes: Russia's 5th-gen platform with N036 Byelka AESA radar (400 km detection), internal bays for 6 R-77M/R-37M BVR missiles, and low RCS for first-shot advantage; integrates with A-50U via secure datalinks for 350+ km networked envelopes; 2024 deliveries boosted to 3 squadrons by late 2025.

4.5-gen supermaneuverable jet with Irbis-E PESA radar (400 km range), thrust-vectoring, and 12 external BVR missiles (up to 8 R-37M); excels in lofted launches and ECCM for high Pk at NEZ; core of VKS fighter fleet, with 16 added in 2024.

Twin-seat long-range platform with Bars-R AESA radar (200+ km), 12-missile BVR loadout, and thrust-vectoring for sustained engagements; SM2 upgrades add hypersonic R-37M; vital for two-ship tactics and A-50 cueing, with 4 more delivered in 2024.

Mach 2.8 high-altitude interceptor with Zhuk-MS upgrade (300 km detection), specialized for 4-6 R-37M launches against AWACS/tankers; extends BVR envelope to 400 km via OTH integration; backbone of air defense, with ongoing BM modernizations.

Armored multirole with Kopyo-34 AESA (200 km), 8-12 BVR missiles, and Khibiny EW suite for self-protection; supports SEAD/BVR in contested airspace; fleet grew by 24 in 2024, emphasizing hybrid manned-unmanned ops with Lancet drones.

Upgraded 4th-gen with Zhuk-ME AESA radar (160 km), conformal fuel tanks for extended loiter, and 6 R-77M pylons; cost-effective BVR filler for forward basing; ~15 active post-2022 losses, with upgrades focusing on datalink compatibility.
Modernized Flanker baseline with Bars radar (200 km) and 10 BVR missiles; bridges to Su-35 in reserves; limited but reliable for surge ops, integrated with L-band ground radars for cueing.

Upgraded AEW with Vega-M radar (400 km horizon) for off-board targeting and mid-course missile updates; critical kill-chain enabler despite losses (6 operational post-upgrades); 2025 focus on Il-76A-90 replacements.
